body_content.explanation: (of fruit or crops) the quality of being ready to be collected or eaten:
examples: Cooking time will vary according to the ripeness of the pears.
The fruit should reach its maximum ripeness after a few days.

body_content.explanation: the quality of being fully developed:
examples: His intellectual powers had come very gradually to ripeness.
He had hot-housed his game to perfect ripeness.

body_content.explanation: the condition of having a very strong, usually unpleasant, smell:
examples: A large pair of boots with socks still inside had been left under one of the beds; their ripeness soured the entire room.

body_content.explanation: (of someone's language) the fact of being very rude:
examples: There are well-documented instances of the ripeness of his language to journalists.
